newsitem.title: MEXICO: IFC, GMD reach $45 mln financing deal.
newsitem.headline: IFC, GMD reach $45 mln financing deal.

text.p: The International Finance Corporation (IFC) and Mexican construction firm Grupo Mexicano de Desarrollo (GMD) have reached an agreement on a $45 million financing package, GMD said.
The IFC would "promote the participation of the international financing community" in generating a $45 million credit, GMD said in news release on Monday.
"This credit has the objective of improving the system for distributing water in the cities of Cancun and Isla Mujeres," GMD said, referring to two Mexican Caribbean resorts in Quintana Roo state.
GMD has a 30-year exclusive contract for water treatment and distribution systems in Quintana Roo, the news release said.
The IFC deal was signed with GMD's subsidiary Desarrollos Hidraulicos de Cancun SA de CV.
